perturbation.original_text: Each party to the agreement expressly authorizes each other party to file on its behalf any and all amendments to such statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party to the agreement may authorize another party to file amendments, however, such authorization may be revoked at any time with written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction by stating that authorization can be revoked. The original text implies a standing authorization, but the modified text creates uncertainty about the stability and enforceability of the authorization. This would make it hard to enforce and ensure proper legal filing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Rule 13d-1(k) - requirements for joint filing agreements.

perturbation.original_text: Each party to this agreement agrees that this joint filing agreement may be signed in counterparts.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party to this agreement hopes this joint filing agreement can be signed in counterparts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that agreement MAY be signed in counterparts. This introduces a lack of a direct commitment by all parties. This phrasing could be interpreted as non-binding and creates ambiguity. The word change has the effect of introducing uncertainty as to the agreement's adherence.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Rule 13d-1(k) - requirements for joint filing agreements.
